definition: to penetrate/to see through
to know/knowledge/Taiwan pr. [shi4]
to record/to write a footnote
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to see through a trick

sentences.english: He's found out about the ruse, but his demands for an apartment haven't wavered.
sentences.chinese: 张炘炀识破了这个花招，没有动摇自己的主张。

sentences.english: Since they are better able to detect them, they have to worry less about being duped.
sentences.chinese: 自从他们又能力识破谎言以来，他们就很少担心被骗。

sentences.english: You made a point, and I get it. Now give It back.
sentences.chinese: 我识破你的小把戏了，把它交出来。

sentences.english: The devil trick is seen all of a sudden through.
sentences.chinese: 魔鬼的鬼计一下子就被识破。

sentences.english: Nobody saw through his disguise,but his accent gave him away.
sentences.chinese: 没有人识破他的伪装，但是他的口音暴露了自己。

sentences.english: I finally wised up  to his tricks.
sentences.chinese: 我最后识破了他的诡计。

sentences.english: Many fake the real thing, merchants can not see through at once.
sentences.chinese: 许多假货可以乱真，商家无法一下子识破。

sentences.english: The police has wised up their game.
sentences.chinese: 警察识破了他们的鬼把戏。

sentences.english: I've got wise to his tricks, he can't cheat me any more.
sentences.chinese: 我已经识破了他的诡计，他再也骗不了我了。

sentences.english: You'll be onto his tricks soon.
sentences.chinese: 你很快就会识破他的诡计。

sentences.english: Research shows the average person barely does any better than chance.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示，一般人识破谎言的本事不比碰运气强多少。

sentences.english: Children will soon see through empty praise.
sentences.chinese: 记住，孩子马上就能识破夸大其辞的赞扬。

sentences.english: The spy doesn't know we have him pegged.
sentences.chinese: 那个间谍不知道我们已经把他识破了。

sentences.english: Mr He eight see through the counsel of the keyboard, command set.
sentences.chinese: 贺老八识破了李剑的计谋，命令手下放火。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, it came to pass that Jean Valjean sometimes espied him.
sentences.chinese: 但是有时候，冉阿让仍识破了他。

sentences.english: so when you place the mouse in the tank it cannot see through.
sentences.chinese: 所以当您将水箱中的鼠标不能识破。

definition: to expose/to uncover
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
trick/ruse/crafty scheme
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to uncover
to get away with it/to slip through/to bluff one's way out/Taiwan pr. [meng1 hun4 guo4 guan1]
to fall into a trap/taken in by a stratagem/cheated/ripped off
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
diversionary tactic/smokescreen
